description: Hauser is expected to miss a few weeks, according to John Karalis the Boston Sports Journal.
The Nets announced that Harris will miss the rest of the season as he recovers from ankle surgery.
Simmons has not played this season.
The Bulls announced that Ball won't return this season.
The Bulls announced that LaVine underwent surgery on his left knee and is expected to make a full recovery.
Sexton underwent surgery on a torn meniscus in his left knee and is expected to miss the rest of the season, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
Wade underwent surgery and won't return this season.
The Mavericks announced that Hardaway Jr. suffered a fracture in his left foot.
Murray is recovering from a torn ACL and no timetable has been announced for his return.
Porter Jr. has been cleared for on-court contact and is hoping to return sometime in March, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
The Pistons announced that Diallo will miss the rest of the season with a left index finger avulsion fracture.
The Pistons announced that Grant will miss the rest of the season with a left calf strain.
The Warriors announced that Igoudala is showing progress and his status will be updated when he is cleared to re-join team practice activities.
The Warriors announced that Payton II has resumed light individual on-court activities and will be re-evaluated in one week.
Porter Jr. did not play in Thursday's (May 26) game against Dallas.
The Warriors announced that Wiseman will miss the rest of the season as he recovers from a right knee injury.
Duarte will not play for the rest of the 2021-22 season, according to Scott Agness of Fieldhouse Files.
Rubio suffered a torn ACL in his left knee, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
Turner will not return to game action this season, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
Warren will not play for the Pacers this season, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
Leonard is ahead of schedule on his ACL rehab and could return this season yet, according to Chris Haynes of Yahoo Sports.
Preston had right foot surgery and is expected to miss a significant part of the season, according to Adrian Wojnarowksi of ESPN.
Scrubb will undergo season-ending surgery, according to Law Murray of The Athletic.
Nunn suffered a setback as he tried to ramp-up activity on his knee, according to Matt Peralta of Lakersnation.com. There is no timetable for his return.
Herro is out for Friday's (May 27) game against Boston.
Middleton is expected to miss Milwaukee's second-round series against Boston, according to Shams Charania of The Athletic.
The Pelicans announced that Lewis Jr. suffered a torn ACL and a grade 2 MCL sprain.
The Knicks announced that Reddish will miss the rest of the season with an AC joint injury.
Bazley is out for the season with a non-displaced tibial plateau fracture in his right knee according to Thunder Communications.
Dort hasn't played since Feb. 12 against Chicago. A timetable for his return has not been announced.
Thunder coach Mark Daigneault said Favors won't return this season.
Thunder coach Mark Daignault announced that Gilgeous-Alexander will miss the rest of the season.
The Thunder announced that Jerome will miss the rest of the season.
The Thunder announced that Muscala will miss the rest of the season.
Bol is having surgery on his foot and will be sidelined 8-12 weeks, according to Shams Charania of The Athletic.
The Magic announced that Isaac will miss the rest of the season.
The Magic announced that Suggs underwent surgery and is expected to be ready for the start of training camp.
The 76ers announced that Green has a torn ACL and LCL in his left knee.
Saric had surgery repair his right knee. There is no timetable for his return, according to Dave McMenamin of ESPN.
The Trail Blazers announced that Bledsoe won't return this season.
Ingles suffered a torn left ACL in Sunday's (Jan. 30) game against Minnesota.
Lillard will not return this season, according to Shams Charania of The Athletic.
The Trail Blazers announced that Little will undergo surgery and miss the remainder of the season.
The Trail Blazers announced that Nurkic won't return this season.
The Trail Blazers announced that Simons won't return this season.
The Kings announced that Davis had surgery on his right wrist. He will be re-evaluated in three months.
McDermott will miss the rest of the season with a Grade 3 ankle sprain, according to Jeff McDonald of The San Antonio Express-News.
Azubuike suffered a severe sprain and is expected to miss an extended period of time.
The Jazz announced that Forrest has a left midfoot ligament sprain and will be re-evaluated weekly.
Beal will undergo season ending surgery on his left wrist, according to Adrian Wojnarowski of ESPN.
